subject: Re: The Ovilus
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Interesting... so this device senses changing temperatures, etc and 
begins speaking differents words or phrases with these changes?

Humm... that 8-in-one paranormal box I put together a while back 
senses many different things also, but I never thought about putting 
those sensor inputs into a chip that speaks.  I now uses meters and 
lights, and alarms when the thing senses different things. But I'm 
guessing I can tap into the circuits and pick a place where the 
different voltages (ever changing) are and put those into the input 
of a speaking chip.

Humm... I may just have to open it up again and see what I can do...

- Mike

they

> The Ovilus has the ability to form words in the phonetic mode, 
which I
> was not using. Does it have the ability to form words in the
> dictionary mode? I do not know. It would seem unlikely. Can spirits
> speak through the Ovilus like they do Frank's box? Maybe. Frank's 
box
> has a lot of white noise that can possibly be manipulated by spirits
> into giving us messages, but the ovilus has words programmed into 
it's
> memory, it would probably take a lot more for entities to inject a
> word into the computer's memory than to inject a word into white
> noise. A lot of the words that are coming through that are not on 
the
> list is meaningless jibberish as the ovilus detects temperature
> changes and has nothing to do with the paranormal. I do not believe
> that the temperture changing could manipulate the components of this
> device to the degree that would be needed to actually create words
> like it is doing. I am betting if enough people catalog words that 
it
> is saying we'll probably wind up with another 500 or so beyond what 
it
> was supposed to be capable of. 
> 
> I emailed the creator yesterday offering to send him sound files of
> the words I am getting so that he can properly identify which of the
> 512 words these are, but so far I have not heard back from him in
> regards to this. 
>
